Class CcddRateParameterHandler

        protected boolean isIncludeUneven()
        Get the value of the flag that indicates if unevenly time-space sample rates are to be included
        Returns:
        true if unevenly time-spaced sample rate values are included; false if only sample rates that are evenly time-spaced are included

      • renameRateInformation

        protected void renameRateInformation(java.lang.String oldRateName,
                                     java.lang.String newRateName)
        Change the rate column name for in the rate information list. If the original rate column name matches one in another table type then create a new rate entry instead of renaming the existing one. If the new rate column name matches one in another table type then merge it with the existing one and delete the original
        Parameters:
        oldRateName - current rate column name
        newRateName - new rate column name

      • deleteRateInformation

        protected void deleteRateInformation(java.lang.String rateName)
        Remove the specified rate's information from the list
        Parameters:
        rateName - rate name for the rate information object to remove

        Returns:

        Get the number of unique rate columns

        Number of unique rate columns

        Set the rate information list based on the unique rate columns
        Returns:
        true if the number of rate columns changed

      • getRateParameters

        private void getRateParameters()
        Get the rate parameters from the database and calculate the sample rates

      • setRateParameters

        protected void setRateParameters(int maxSecPerMsg,
                                 int maxMsgsPerSec,
                                 java.lang.String[] streamName,
                                 int[] maxMsgsPerCycle,
                                 int[] maxBytesPerSec,
                                 boolean includeUneven,
                                 java.awt.Component parent)
        Set the rate parameters, store them in the project database, and calculate the sample rates
        Parameters:
        maxSecPerMsg - maximum number of seconds allowed between downlinking two of the same message
        maxMsgsPerSec - maximum number of messages that can be downlinked in one second
        streamName - array containing the stream name per stream
        maxMsgsPerCycle - array containing the maximum number of messages that can be downlinked before repeating the message list per stream
        maxBytesPerSec - array containing the maximum number of bytes that can be downlinked in one second per stream
        includeUneven - true to include unevenly time-spaced sample rate values; false to only include sample rates that are evenly time-spaced
        parent - component calling this method, used for positioning any error dialogs

      • calculateSampleRates

        private void calculateSampleRates()
        Build the array of valid sample rates for all rate columns based on the current rate parameters. Update open table editors that have a Rate column

      • calculateSampleRates

        protected java.lang.String[] calculateSampleRates(int maxSecPerMsg,
                                                  int maxMsgsPerSec,
                                                  int maxMsgsPerCycle,
                                                  boolean includeUneven)
        Build the array of valid sample rates based on the specified rate parameters
        Parameters:
        maxSecPerMsg - maximum number of seconds allowed between downlinking two of the same message
        maxMsgsPerSec - maximum number of messages that can be downlinked in one second
        maxMsgsPerCycle - maximum number of messages that can be downlinked before repeating the message list per stream
        includeUneven - true to include unevenly time-spaced sample rate values; false to only include sample rates that are evenly time-spaced
        Returns:
        Array containing the valid sample rates

      • formatRate

        private java.lang.String formatRate(double samples,
                                    double seconds)
        Format a rate value as the specified number of samples over the specified number of seconds. Use whole numbers if possible; otherwise use the format '1/x', where 'x' is the number of seconds rounded to 5 decimal places. Remove any extra trailing zeroes after the decimal and the decimal if no zeroes remain for both the numerator and denominator
        Parameters:
        samples - number of samples
        seconds - number of seconds
        Returns:
        Rate, in samples per second, displaying a maximum of 5 decimal places)

      • getDataStreamNames

        protected java.lang.String[] getDataStreamNames()
        Get an array containing the unique data stream names
        Returns:
        Array containing the unique data stream names

      • getRatesInUse

        protected java.lang.String[] getRatesInUse(java.lang.String rateName,
                                           java.awt.Component parent)
        Get the array of the sample rate values for the specified rate column name with those rates not assigned to any telemetry parameter in the structure tables grayed out
        Parameters:
        rateName - rate column name
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        Array of the sample rate values for the specified rate column name with those rates not assigned to any telemetry parameter in the structure tables grayed out; an empty array if the rate name isn't valid
